channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-20378] don't update stats during alter for txn table conversion
item.summary: don't update stats during alter for txn table conversion

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: ekoifman can you take a look?

-1 overall

ATTACHMENT ID: 12935464 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Failures are due to HS2 port conflict during setup; bogus
If I start with a table with stats, and convert it transactional, this will set stats_accurate to false. Am I reading this right? Isn't better to set DO_NOT_UPDATE_STATS?

As far as I see the path already sets the flag. Also setting updateStats... to false is intended to prevent that.
However if we missed some other paths, they'll just invalidate the stats

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12935611/HIVE-20378.02.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12935611 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

ekoifman ping?

I actually wonder if we should even allow stats on txn tables without write ID/etc. Perhaps it would be better in a follow up to make sure we create write ID for conversion, nothing in the DB structure prevents it as far as I can tell.
